message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $10,000. It's a great deal considering its value to you. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8,000. I'm really interested in the product, but I have a limited budget.

Bob, I appreciate your interest in the product. While I understand your budget constraints, $8,000 is unfortunately too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $9,500. This still leaves some room for profit for you, and it's a fair price considering the value of the product. Let me know what you think.

I appreciate your willingness to come down, but $9,500 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $9,000. I'm really interested in the product, and I'm hoping we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.

Bob, I understand your situation, but I'm still not quite there yet. $9,000 is closer, but I need to be closer to $9,250 to make this work for me. I'm confident that this price still represents a good deal for you, given the product's value. Let's see if we can find a solution that benefits both of us.

I appreciate your flexibility, but $9,250 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $9,125. I'm really interested in the product, and I think this price is a fair compromise.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, and I truly value your interest in the product.  While $9,125 is closer, I still need to be at $9,200 to make this work for me.  This is a fair price considering the product's value and the time we've invested in negotiating.  Let's try to finalize this deal. What do you say?

I understand that you're trying to make a profit, but I'm really trying to stick to my budget. I'm willing to go up to $9,150, but no higher. I think this is a fair price considering the value of the product and the negotiations we've had so far.
